name: Crispy Brie and Cranberry Rice Paper Bites

name: I Tried Our 5 Most Popular Cranberry Sauce Recipes and Found a Flavor-Packed Favorite for Thanksgiving
Tangerine Cherry Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cherries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'tangerine juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'tangerine zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole star anise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}
steps: Combine cranberries, cherries, sugar, tangerine juice, tangerine zest, star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to low and cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries are all popped, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool to room temperature. Discard star anise, cinnamon stick, and whole cloves, and refrigerate until needed.

name: Fresh Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries (such as Ocean Spray)'}

name: Cranberry Sauce with Orange Juice
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Combine sugar and orange juice in a medium saucepan over medium heat; stir until sugar is dissolved. Mix in cranberries; cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries start to pop, about 10 minutes.. Transfer to a bowl; sauce will thicken as it cools.

name: Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}

name: Amazing Pineapple Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'pineapple chunks with juice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'water as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Drain juice from canned pineapple into a measuring cup. Fill the measuring cup with enough water to equal 1 cup liquid altogether.. Stir pineapple juice mixture and sugar together in a saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Add cranberries and return to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until cranberries burst, about 10 minutes.. Mix pineapple chunks into cranberry mixture. Cool to room temperature before serving.

name: Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, peeled and pureed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apple - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pear - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped dried mixed fruit'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped pecans'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}
steps: In a medium saucepan, boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves. Reduce the heat to simmer, and stir in cranberries, pureed orange, apple, pear, dried fruit, pecans, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg. Cover, and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries burst. Remove from heat, and let cool to room temperature.

name: Slow Cooker Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Combine orange juice, water, brown sugar, white sugar, and cinnamon in slow cooker; stir in cranberries. Cook on High for 3 hours, stirring once each hour.. Remove lid; stir well. Cook on High until sauce has thickened and most cranberries have popped, about 45 more minutes.

name: Blue Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'fresh blueberries'}
steps: Wash and pick over cranberries. Place in a medium saucepan with water, and sugar. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, stir and simmer for 10 minutes or until cranberries burst.. Slightly mash the cranberries with the back of a wooden spoon to insure all skins are broken. Add the cinnamon, nutmeg and allspice. Mix well.. Remove from heat and mix in the blueberries (don't be afraid to break a few, but don't over mash either). The sauce will thicken as it cools.. Transfer to a bowl, cool slightly and place plastic wrap directly on top of sauce to cover. Refrigerate until chilled.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Apples
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed and sorted'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Granny Smith apples - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}

name: Jalapeño Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed and drained'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'jalapeño peppers, seeded and minced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sherry'}

name: 9 Quick and Easy Homemade Cranberry Sauces
Cranberry Raspberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Merlot wine'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Put cranberries, raspberries, Merlot, and sugar in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Use a whisk to mash cranberries. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.. Serve hot or pour sauce into a container and refrigerate to serve cold.

name: Cranberry Orange Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick, broken in half'}
steps: Mix cranberries, brown sugar, orange juice, orange zest, and cinnamon stick together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until cranberries pop and sauce is thickened, about 15 minutes.. For best results, transfer cranberry sauce to a bowl and refrigerate until chilled, at least 1 hour. Remove cinnamon stick from sauce and serve at room temperature.. Remove cinnamon stick from sauce and serve at room temperature.

name: Orange Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'oranges'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water, or as needed to cover'}
steps: Zest and juice oranges; set juice aside.. Combine cranberries, sugar, and orange zest in a saucepan; stir to combine. Cover with water and bring to a boil. Cook until cranberries begin to burst, 5 to 10 minutes.. Reduce the heat to low, stir in orange juice, and simmer until flavors blend, about 1 hour.. Remove from the heat and cool to room temperature, about 20 minutes. Refrigerate until jelled, at least 1 hour.

name: Brandied Orange and Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange zest'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brandy'}
steps: Inspect four 1/2-pint jars for cracks and rings for rust, discarding any defective ones. Immerse in simmering water until cranberry sauce is ready. Wash new, unused lids and rings in warm soapy water.. Combine water and orange zest in a small pan over medium heat; cover and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Drain, reserving all zest and 1/3 cup liquid.. Return zest and reserved liquid to the pan; add sugar, orange juice, and lemon juice. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat and simmer, stirring often, for 3 minutes.. Add cranberries. Increase the heat to medium-high and boil until cranberries have popped and a small spoonful of sauce sets on a cold plate, about 10 minutes.. Remove from the heat and stir in brandy. Pour into the prepared jars, filling to within 1/2 inch of the top. Cool to room temperature, then seal and store in the refrigerator.

name: Holiday Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole allspice berries'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}
steps: Wrap cinnamon sticks, cloves, and allspice berries in a spice bag.. Combine cranberries, water, and spice bag in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until cranberries begin to burst, about 10 minutes.. Stir in sugar and reduce the heat to low. Continue cooking until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.. Remove and discard spice bag. Cover cranberry sauce and chill in the refrigerator before serving, 8 hours to overnight.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Bourbon
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bourbon'}

name: Maple Syrup Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brandy'}
steps: Combine water and maple syrup in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Add cranberries; cook at a boil until berries pop, 10 to 15 minutes. Stir in brown sugar and lemon juice until sugar is completely dissolved. Stir in brandy.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Orange Juice and Brown Sugar
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Combine water, brown sugar, orange juice, cinnamon stick, ginger, orange zest, salt, cloves, and allspice in a medium saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until sugar is dissolved, 3 to 5 minutes.. Stir in cranberries and return to a boil over medium heat. Cook until cranberries start to burst and mixture thickens slightly, 8 to 10 minutes; sauce will thicken further upon cooling.. Transfer cranberry sauce to a bowl; remove and discard cinnamon stick. Store in the refrigerator until serving.

name: Brown Sugar and Port Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange, juiced and zested'}, {'quantity': '9', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'port wine'}
steps: In a large saucepan, combine the cranberries, brown sugar, orange zest and juice, and port wine. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, stirring until the sugar has dissolved. Reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer until the cranberries have popped and the sauce has thickened, about 15 minutes. Cool, and refrigerate overnight before serving.

name: Cranberry Sauce II
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}
steps: In a microwave safe bowl, mix together cranberries, sugar and water. Cover the mixture with wax paper and microwave on high power until the cranberries pop (about 7 minutes). Chill before serving.

name: Pear Honey Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pears - peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated lemon zest'}
steps: In a medium saucepan, stir together the water and sugar over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil. Stir in pears, and reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring frequently for 3 minutes, then stir in cranberries and honey. Continue to cook until cranberries pop and the mixture thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.. Remove from heat and stir in the lemon juice and lemon zest. Cool to room temperature, then store covered in the refrigerator for up to one week.

name: Ginger Pear Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'Bosc pear, peeled and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'candied ginger, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, zested'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole star anise pod'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garam masala'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Combine cranberries, diced pear, orange juice, sugar, water, candied ginger, orange zest, star anise, cinnamon stick, garam masala, and salt in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to boil, reduce heat to medium, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until cranberries have softened, 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool completely.. Remove cinnamon stick and star anise. Chill until ready to serve.

name: Easy Cranberry Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and cut into 1-inch chunks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'lemon juice'}
steps: Stir apples, cranberries, sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt together in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and cook until apples and cranberries are tender, about 20 minutes. Remove from heat.. Stir lemon juice into cranberry mixture.. Mash cranberry mixture with a wooden spoon or fork to make a chunky sauce.

name: Patti's Triple Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen cranberry juice concentrate, thawed'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'orange marmalade'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced orange peel'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice (Optional)'}
steps: Stir the cranberry juice concentrate and sugar together in a saucepan over medium-high heat, and bring to a boil, stirring until sugar has dissolved. Mix in the fresh and dried cranberries, reduce heat to medium, and cook until the dried cranberries soften and the fresh ones pop, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat.. Mix in the orange marmalade, orange juice, orange peel, and allspice until thoroughly combined. Allow the cranberry sauce to cool completely. Pour into glass serving dish, cover, and chill until cold, at least 2 hours. Can be made up to 2 days ahead of time and refrigerated until serving.

name: Spiced Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Heat orange juice and water in a saucepan over medium heat until warm, about 3 minutes. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Mix in cinnamon stick, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice. Add cranberries and cook, stirring occasionally, until they pop, about 10 minutes.. Remove from heat and pour sauce into a bowl. Cover and refrigerate, 8 hours to overnight.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Orange Juice, Honey, and Pears
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pears, diced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}
steps: Heat orange juice and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Stir in cranberries, and cook until they start to pop, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in pears, honey, and cinnamon sticks and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and transfer to a bowl. Cranberry sauce will thicken as it cools. Remove cinnamon sticks before serving.

name: Holiday Cranberry and Apple Compote
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'Fuji apples, peeled and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter, softened'}
steps: Combine orange juice, apples, cranberries, white sugar, brown sugar, and pumpkin pie spice in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until apples are tender and sauce has thickened slightly, 20 to 25 minutes.. Transfer sauce to a dish; stir in softened butter and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. Sauce will continue to thicken.

name: Superb Cranberry Sauce with Apples and Pears
ingredients: {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '(3 inch)', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole allspice berries'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2 ¼', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Gala apples, peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Bosc pears, peeled, cored and diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}
steps: Place the cinnamon sticks, allspice berries, and cloves onto the center of a 8 inch square piece of cheesecloth. Gather together the edges of the cheesecloth, and tie with kitchen twine to secure. Place the sachet into a large saucepan along with the cranberries and orange juice. Bring to a boil over high heat, and cook until the berries begin to burst, about 10 minutes.. Stir in the apples, pears, white sugar, and brown sugar. Return to a boil, then reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer about 25 minutes until the apples and pears are slightly soft. Remove and discard the spice sachet. Scrape the sauce into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate overnight. Serve cold.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Apricots, Raisins, and Orange
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped dried apricots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden raisins'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}
steps: In a large saucepan over medium heat, mix the orange juice, water, cranberries, sugar, apricots, raisins, and orange zest. Stir constantly until sugar has dissolved, about 5 minutes. Bring to a boil, and cook 10 minutes, or until cranberries have burst. Remove from heat, and chill at least 8 hours, or overnight, before serving cold.

name: Dried Cherry and Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cranberry juice cocktail'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick, broken in half'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'dried cherries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Stir the cranberry juice cocktail, water, brown sugar, cinnamon stick, and allspice together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Add the cherries to the cranberry juice mixture; cook another 2 minutes. Add the cranberries; continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the cranberries pop, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and chill in refrigerator 8 hours to overnight. Remove and discard cinnamon stick before serving.

name: Chef John's Mango Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'dried candied mango, finely diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, zested'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'finely grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole star anise pod'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'garam masala'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'drops', 'name': 'hot sauce (preferably ghost pepper hot sauce), or more to taste'}
steps: Place diced mango into a saucepan and stir in lemon zest, orange zest, and ginger. Pour in lemon and orange juice and mix in cinnamon stick, star anise pod, garam masala, and salt. Pour in water and sugar; stir until sugar has dissolved.. Place saucepan over medium heat, bring just to a simmer, and reduce heat to low. Simmer until mango has softened and flavors blend, about 15 minutes.. Pour cranberries into sauce, raise heat to medium, and cook until cranberries pop and begin to break down, about 10 minutes. Mash any unpopped berries.. Turn off heat and drizzle 2 or 3 drops of ghost pepper hot sauce. Let cranberry sauce cool to room temperature and transfer to a serving bowl. Remove cinnamon stick and star anise pod before serving.

name: Easy Instant Pot Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}
steps: Combine cranberries, sugar, orange juice, orange zest, and salt in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, 10 to 40 minutes. Unlock and remove lid. Add cinnamon stick and select Saute function; cook until sauce thickens, 5 to 10 minutes. Remove and discard cinnamon stick.. Blend sauce with an immersion blender for a smoother consistency. Let cool; sauce will continue to thicken naturally.

name: Tangy Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'prepared horseradish'}
steps: Place cranberries and water in a medium saucepan. Over high heat, cook until the cranberries burst.. Lower heat to simmer. Stir in sugar. Continue cooking 15 minutes.. Allow mixture to cool. Stir in horseradish. Chill in the refrigerator until serving.

name: Delicious Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries'}
steps: Place the sugars, orange juice, water, and cinnamon in a heavy saucepan, and stir to dissolve the sugar. Add the cranberries and bring the mixture to a boil. Cook over medium heat until the berries pop, about 10 minutes. Mash the mixture with a spoon to pop any unpopped berries and help thicken the sauce, if desired, and reduce heat to low and simmer until the sauce is the desired thickness, up to 10 more minutes.. Remove from the heat, pour the sauce into a bowl, and chill until serving time. Sauce will thicken as it cools.

name: Apple Cider Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}
steps: Combine the apple cider, sugar, cinnamon sticks, orange zest, and cloves in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Turn heat to low; simmer until sugar is dissolved and the flavors are blended, 10 to 15 minutes.. Stir cranberries into the saucepan, turn heat to high, and bring to a boil. Cook, stirring constantly, until cranberries begin to pop, 5 to 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low, and cook until sauce begins to thicken, about 5 minutes. Remove cinnamon sticks and cloves. Pour into shallow dish to cool and serve.

name: Ginger-Cinnamon Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1 inch) piece', 'name': 'fresh ginger, peeled'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}
steps: Bring water and sugar to a boil in a pot over medium heat; boil for 5 minutes stirring occasionally. Add the cranberries, ginger, and cinnamon stick; return the mixture to a boil and cook until the cranberries start popping, about 5 minutes. Transfer the sauce to a shallow container; chill in refrigerator until cold, about 3 hours.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Walnuts
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'oranges, zested'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'walnuts, chopped'}
steps: Combine cranberries, orange juice, sugar, and orange zest in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to boil, reduce heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Stir in walnuts. Refrigerate 8 hours to overnight before serving.

name: Instant Pot Cherry-Orange Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cherries, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange marmalade (such as Smuckers® Natural)'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}
steps: Combine cranberries, cherries, water, cinnamon, and salt in the inner pot of a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 2 minutes. Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes. Switch to the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions to release remaining pressure, about 5 minutes. Unlock and remove the lid.. Select Saute function and low heat. Add orange marmalade and brown sugar to the cranberry mixture. Cook and stir to combine, breaking up cranberries, 2 to 3 minutes. Turn off Instant Pot and let cranberry sauce cool. Sauce will thicken upon cooling. Store in the refrigerator. For best flavor, bring to room temperature before serving.

name: Cranberry Pomegranate Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'tart apples'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'pomegranates, peeled and seeds separated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 fl oz) bottle', 'name': 'pomegranate juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'oranges'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bags', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed and sorted'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecans, chopped'}
steps: Peel and core apples, and put peelings and cores in a small saucepan with pomegranate seeds, 1/2 cup juice, and 1/2 cup sugar. Bring to a boil, and then reduce heat to simmer. Cook for 30 minutes.. Chop the peeled apples, and place in a large saucepan. Remove zest from half of one orange, chop very fine, and add to apples. Peel oranges, chop coarsely, and add to pan along with cranberries and remaining juice and sugar. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to simmer, and cook for 30 minutes.. Remove small pan from heat, and strain juice into larger pan. Cool solids slightly, and then push though a sieve to remove seeds and peels, adding remaining pulp to larger pan. Stir in nuts, if desired. Cook about 10 minutes longer. Serve warm, room temperature, or chilled.

name: Berry Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'honey'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'blueberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'raspberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, juiced and zested'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'pumpkin pie spice'}
steps: Stir 1 cup orange juice, water, sugar, and honey together in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil and stir cranberries, blueberries, raspberries, orange juice, and orange zest into mixture. Reduce heat to low and simmer, mashing berries occasionally to create a thicker texture, 15 to 20 minutes. Stir pumpkin pie spice into sauce. Refrigerate at least 3 hours up to overnight before serving.

name: Fresh Cranberry-Orange Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cranberry juice'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'pear - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'star anise'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'orange marmalade'}
steps: Combine orange juice, cranberry juice, and sugar in a saucepan over medium-high heat; bring to a boil. Cook, stirring occasionally, for about 5 minutes.. Stir in 1/2 of the cranberries, pear, orange zest, vanilla extract, star anise, and salt, and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the remaining cranberries and cook, stirring often, until cranberries start to burst and mixture starts to thicken, about 10 minutes.. Remove from heat. Stir in orange marmalade and set aside. Sauce will continue to thicken as it cools. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Fig and Rosemary Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'maple extract'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '10', 'unit': '', 'name': 'dried Mission figs, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(5 inch)', 'name': 'fresh rosemary sprig'}
steps: Bring water, brown sugar, and maple extract to a boil in a non-reactive saucepan. Add cranberries and figs. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently, until slightly thickened, about 5 minutes. Add rosemary and cook until sauce is thickened, about 5 minutes more.. Carefully remove rosemary sprig and discard. Remove pot from the burner and let cool, about 10 minutes. Pour sauce into a bowl and refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Our 13 Best Cranberry Sauce, Relish, and Chutney Recipes of All Time
Tangerine-Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': "confectioners' sugar, or more to taste"}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tangerine, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tangerine, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}
steps: Stir cranberries, confectioners' sugar, tangerine juice, tangerine zest, and cinnamon together in a non-stick saucepan over medium heat; bring to a simmer, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the cranberries pop and the mixture thickens, 15 to 20 minutes. Crush any remaining whole cranberries against the sides of the saucepan with a spatula to burst.

name: Tequila and Orange Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.5 fluid ounce) jigger', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ¾', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Bring orange juice, tequila, and orange zest to a boil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add cranberries, sugar, and salt; simmer until a jam-like sauce forms, about 25 minutes.. Blend sauce with an immersion blender for a smoother consistency. Let cool; sauce will continue to thicken naturally.

name: Ginger Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}
steps: Combine cranberries, sugar, orange zest and juice in a large pot and heat over medium heat. Cook and stir occasionally until berries pop, about 20 minutes. Let cool until thickened.

name: Drunken Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'cranberries, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(1.5 fluid ounce) jigger', 'name': 'tequila'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'oranges, zested'}
steps: Heat a saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir sugar, orange juice, half the cranberries, and tequila in the warmed saucepan until mixture is slightly reduced, about 20 minutes. Add the remaining cranberries and orange zest; cook and stir until cranberries begin to pop, 10 to 15 minutes.

name: Boozy Fresh Cranberry-Orange Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'whole fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange-flavored liqueur (such as Cointreau®)'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt, or to taste'}
steps: Combine cranberries, sugar, water, orange zest, orange juice, orange-flavored liqueur, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook, stirring frequently, for about 20 minutes.. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Sauce with thicken as it cools, to a soft-preserves stage. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Ultimate Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted pecans'}
steps: Combine the sugar, orange zest and juice, and ginger in a pot over medium heat; cook and stir until the sugar is completely dissolved, about 5 minutes. Add the cranberries to the orange juice mixture; cook until the cranberries pop, about 5 minutes. Stir the pecans through the cranberry mixture; remove from heat and allow to cool completely before serving.

name: Becky's Mom's Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brandy-based orange liqueur (such as Grand Marnier®)'}
steps: Preheat oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).. Stir together the cranberries, sugar, and liqueur in a baking dish.. Bake in preheated oven for 1 1/2 hours, stirring every 20 minutes. Store refrigerated in a tightly-covered container.

name: Grandma's Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'navel oranges - washed thoroughly, unpeeled, cut into quarters'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored and halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pecans'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or to taste'}
steps: Place the cranberries, oranges, apples, pecans, and sugar in the bowl of a food processor. Process until all ingredients are evenly ground, 2-3 minutes. Pour mixture into a bowl, cover, and refrigerate at least 2 days before serving.

name: Fresh Sweet Cranberry Sauce with a Twist
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed'}
steps: Stir sugar, water, and cinnamon together in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Add cranberries to the boiling water mixture and cook until they begin to pop, about 10 minutes. Pour cranberry mixture into a glass bowl.. Refrigerate, stirring occasionally, until completely chilled.

name: Cranberry Sauce with Orange Zest
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'allspice berries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated orange zest'}
steps: Combine orange juice, white sugar, brown sugar, cinnamon, and allspice berries in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes. Add cranberries and cook, stirring occasionally, until cranberries start to pop, about 10 minutes. Mix in orange zest and keep simmering, stirring occasionally, about 10 minutes more. Remove from heat and allow to cool and thicken.

name: Instant Pot Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'cranberries'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'piece', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'slices of orange peel, using a peeler'}
steps: Combine cranberries, orange juice, water, cinnamon stick, and vanilla extract in a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Close and lock the lid. Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 1 minute. Allow about 10 minutes for pressure to build. As soon as the cooking cycle finishes, turn the Instant Pot off, as overcooking the cranberries will cause the skins to break.. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 7 minutes. Unlock and carefully remove the lid.. Turn Instant Pot back on and select Sauté function. Stir white sugar and brown sugar into cranberry mixture until sugar melts. Season with a pinch of salt. As soon as sugar has melted, turn off the Instant Pot to avoid overcooking. Taste cranberry sauce and stir in more sugar, 1 tablespoon at a time, depending on how sweet you like your cranberry sauce.. Transfer sauce to a serving dish and top with orange peel. Serve warm or cold. Cranberry sauce will thicken as it cools.

name: Hazel's Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'apple cider'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cloves'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bags', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries'}
steps: In a saucepan, stir together the apple cider, white sugar, brown sugar, allspice, cloves, nutmeg and cranberries. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to low and simmer for about 15 minutes, until most of the cranberries have popped. Continue cooking until the consistency is thick.. Ladle into sterile jars to within 1/2 inch of the rim, seal with lids and rings. Process in a simmering water bath for 10 to 15 minutes to seal, or just transfer to containers, cool, and refrigerate. It will last at least a week if it can escape being gobbled up!

name: Spicy Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(8 ounce) cans', 'name': 'pineapple tidbits, drained and patted dry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) can', 'name': 'whole berry cranberry sauce'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh jalapeno chile (or more to taste), seeded and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'sprig', 'name': 'fresh rosemary (Optional)'}
steps: Combine pineapple tidbits, cranberry sauce, brown sugar, ginger, and salt in a saucepan; bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often, until berries pop, about 5 minutes.. Remove from heat and mix in green onions and jalapeno peppers. Garnish with rosemary.

name: Nantucket Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'molasses'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'packed brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries, thawed'}
steps: Place the orange juice, maple syrup, molasses, brown sugar, butter, and salt in a pan. Cook over medium heat until the sugar dissolves. Reduce heat to low, and stir in the cranberries. Cook until cranberries pop, about 10 minutes. Bring the mixture to a boil. Cook and stir until mixture reduces to approximately 1 3/4 cups, about 10 minutes. Cool, cover, and refrigerate until needed.

name: Lemon Ginger Cranberry Applesauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) bag', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'apples - peeled, cored, and diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'lemonade concentrate'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}
steps: Stir cranberries, apples, water, sugar, and lemonade concentrate together in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally, and reduce heat to medium low.. Stir ginger and salt into cranberry mixture and simmer until cranberries burst and apples are tender, 20 minutes. Chill in the refrigerator.

name: Perfect Pomegranate Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(12 ounce) packages', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'turbinado sugar, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'freshly squeezed orange juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dark corn syrup (such as Karo®), or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'port wine, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lime juice, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'orange zest, divided'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'pomegranate, peeled and seeds separated, divided'}
steps: Combine cranberries, sugar, orange juice, water, corn syrup, port wine, lime juice, cinnamon sticks, 1 1/2 teaspoons orange zest, cloves, and 1/4 the pomegranate seeds in a heavy pot; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until cranberries pop and sauce is thickened, about 30 minutes.. Taste the sauce and add more sugar, corn syrup, or port wine if desired. Remove cloves or cinnamon if the taste is overpowering at this point and add more port wine or lime juice.. Continue to simmer sauce, stirring occasionally, until desired consistency is reached, 15 to 30 minutes. Remove pot from heat and cool, about 30 minutes. Sauce will thicken as it cools. Remove cinnamon sticks and cloves if still in sauce. Stir remaining pomegranate seeds into sauce and garnish with remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons orange zest.

name: Nutty Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'orange juice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'triple sec'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fresh cranberries, rinsed'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped walnuts, or to taste'}
steps: Stir sugar, orange juice, triple sec, and water together in a saucepan over medium heat until the sugar dissolves; add cranberries and cook until the berries begin to pop, about 10 minutes.. Pour cranberry sauce into a serving bowl; stir nuts into the sauce. Let sauce cool until thickened, 15 to 20 minutes.

name: Cran-Apple-Pear Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(16 ounce) cans', 'name': 'whole berry cranberry sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(20 ounce) can', 'name': 'apple pie filling'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '(15 ounce) cans', 'name': 'sliced pears, drained'}
steps: In a medium bowl, stir together the cranberry sauce, apple pie filling and pears. Chill until serving.

name: Cranberry-Blueberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'fresh cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'orange, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon sticks'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(2 inch) piece', 'name': 'fresh ginger, grated'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vanilla extract'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole cloves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly grated nutmeg'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground allspice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pint', 'name': 'blueberries'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'maple syrup'}
steps: Mix cranberries, water, orange zest and juice, cinnamon sticks, ginger, vanilla extract, cloves, nutmeg, and allspice together in a large saucepan until well combined; bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer, stirring frequently, until many of the cranberries pop and sauce starts to thicken, about 20 minutes.. Add blueberries and maple syrup; cook and stir until mixture returns to a simmer. Cook, stirring frequently, until desired consistency, about 20 minutes. Allow to cool completely. Remove cinnamon sticks and cloves; refrigerate for 6 hours, to overnight.

name: Debbie's Special Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'fresh or frozen cranberries'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pitted prunes, quartered'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'seedless raspberry jam'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'apple cider vinegar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cinnamon stick'}
steps: Combine the cranberries, prunes, water, raspberry jam, sugar, vinegar, salt, and cinnamon stick in a 3-quart saucepan; bring to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to medium and simmer until thick and most of the cranberries have burst, about 10 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool. Transfer to a container with a lid; cover and refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving.
